GYERANPPANG

Gyeranppang is a Korean rice cake that is made with eggs. It is often served as a snack or breakfast food.

12 servings 30 minutes
THIS IS AN ADVERT

Equipment

  • a bowl
  • a whisk
  • a measuring cup
  • a measuring spoon
  • a 9x13 inch baking pan
  • a spatula

Ingredients

  • 1 cup glutinous rice flour
  • 1 cup water
  • 4 eggs
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 cup sugar
  • 1 teaspoon baking powder
  • 1 tablespoon vegetable oil

Directions

  1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
  2. In a bowl, mix together glutinous rice flour, water, eggs, salt, sugar, and baking powder.
  3. Pour batter into a greased and floured pan.
  4. Bake for 30 minutes.
  5. Remove from oven and let cool before serving.
